Warfarin: Warfarin is an anticoagulation drug that works by inhibiting the synthesis of vitamin K-dependent clotting factors. It binds to plasma proteins, not antithrombin III.
Dabigatran: Dabigatran is an anticoagulation drug that works by inhibiting thrombin. It does not bind to antithrombin III.
Enoxaparin: Enoxaparin is an anticoagulation drug that works by binding to antithrombin III to inhibit factor Xa. It is commonly used for prophylaxis and treatment of deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.
